capabilities.name: get_chain_info
capabilities.description: Get information about an EVM network

capabilities.name: resolve_ens
capabilities.description: Resolve an ENS name to an Ethereum address

capabilities.name: get_supported_networks
capabilities.description: Get a list of supported EVM networks

capabilities.name: get_block_by_number
capabilities.description: Get a block by its block number

capabilities.name: get_latest_block
capabilities.description: Get the latest block from the EVM

capabilities.name: get_balance
capabilities.description: Get the native token balance (ETH, MATIC, etc.) for an address

capabilities.name: get_erc20_balance
capabilities.description: Get the ERC20 token balance of an Ethereum address

capabilities.name: get_token_balance
capabilities.description: Get the balance of an ERC20 token for an address

capabilities.name: get_transaction
capabilities.description: Get detailed information about a specific transaction by its hash. Includes sender, recipient, value, data, and more.

capabilities.name: get_transaction_receipt
capabilities.description: Get a transaction receipt by its hash

capabilities.name: estimate_gas
capabilities.description: Estimate the gas cost for a transaction

capabilities.name: transfer_eth
capabilities.description: Transfer native tokens (ETH, MATIC, etc.) to an address

capabilities.name: transfer_erc20
capabilities.description: Transfer ERC20 tokens to another address

capabilities.name: approve_token_spending
capabilities.description: Approve another address (like a DeFi protocol or exchange) to spend your ERC20 tokens. This is often required before interacting with DeFi protocols.

capabilities.name: transfer_nft
capabilities.description: Transfer an NFT (ERC721 token) from one address to another. Requires the private key of the current owner for signing the transaction.

capabilities.name: transfer_erc1155
capabilities.description: Transfer ERC1155 tokens to another address. ERC1155 is a multi-token standard that can represent both fungible and non-fungible tokens in a single contract.

capabilities.name: transfer_token
capabilities.description: Transfer ERC20 tokens to an address

capabilities.name: read_contract
capabilities.description: Read data from a smart contract by calling a view/pure function. This doesn't modify blockchain state and doesn't require gas or signing.

capabilities.name: write_contract
capabilities.description: Write data to a smart contract by calling a state-changing function. This modifies blockchain state and requires gas payment and transaction signing.

capabilities.name: is_contract
capabilities.description: Check if an address is a smart contract or an externally owned account (EOA)

capabilities.name: get_token_info
capabilities.description: Get comprehensive information about an ERC20 token including name, symbol, decimals, total supply, and other metadata. Use this to analyze any token on EVM chains.

capabilities.name: get_token_balance_erc20
capabilities.description: Get ERC20 token balance for an address

capabilities.name: get_nft_info
capabilities.description: Get detailed information about a specific NFT (ERC721 token), including collection name, symbol, token URI, and current owner if available.

capabilities.name: check_nft_ownership
capabilities.description: Check if an address owns a specific NFT

capabilities.name: get_erc1155_token_uri
capabilities.description: Get the metadata URI for an ERC1155 token (multi-token standard used for both fungible and non-fungible tokens). The URI typically points to JSON metadata about the token.

capabilities.name: get_nft_balance
capabilities.description: Get the total number of NFTs owned by an address from a specific collection. This returns the count of NFTs, not individual token IDs.

capabilities.name: get_erc1155_balance
capabilities.description: Get the balance of a specific ERC1155 token ID owned by an address. ERC1155 allows multiple tokens of the same ID, so the balance can be greater than 1.

capabilities.name: get_address_from_private_key
capabilities.description: Get the EVM address derived from a private key
